question: Which country recently announced its decision to withdraw from Open Skies treaty?
explanation:
The United States recently announced that the country will withdraw from the major global treaty named Open Skies treaty. The 35-nation treaty allows unarmed surveillance flights over the territories of member countries.
US administration also highlighted that Russia has repeatedly violated the terms of the pact. It is expected that the US will pull out formally in six months, based on the withdrawal terms of the treaty. NATO allies and other countries have asked the US to remain in the treaty.
